thread.title: Golden Globes 2017: The 13 Best Beauty Looks on the Red Carpet
thread.title_full: Golden Globes 2017: The 13 Best Beauty Looks on the Red Carpet

author: Calin Van Paris
title: Golden Globes 2017: The 13 Best Beauty Looks on the Red Carpet
text:
View slideshow Photo: AP Images 
The 2017 Golden Globes red carpet was a study in playful polish, with a glittering lineup of sleek hair looks made fresh through the addition of whimsical accessories and nuanced above-the-neck touches. 
Actress (and current Vogue cover girl) Ruth Negga , nominated for her role in Loving , played off the futuristic feel of her light-catching Louis Vuitton dress with a dusting of cool metallic pigment along her eyelids, her ubiquitous close-crop styled into elegant waves. Michelle Williams’s peroxide pixie was worn slick and deeply side-parted—a delicate black bow at the neck and a porcelain complexion striking a deeply feminine chord. 
It was a cool, not-a-hair-out-of-place notion echoed by Jessica Biel and Zoe Saldana’s ladylike tie-backs. Elsewhere, glistening drop earrings pulled focus to Emily Ratajkowski’s abbreviated waves, her chop offset by a makeup palette of warm, peachy tones. And celebrating Atlanta ’s nomination was Zazie Beetz, whose free-form textured mane, glinting modern jewels, and cheeky dots of onyx pigment beneath her lower lashes seemed destined to elicit a double take during her Golden Globes overture—a risk-taking approach we hope to see more of throughout the coming award season.
